API Collection# Collection Implementations

## [Topics](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/collection-implementations#topics)

### [Structures](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/collection-implementations#Structures)

[`struct Index`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/index)A position in a `DiscontiguousSlice`.### [Instance Properties](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/collection-implementations#Instance-Properties)

[`var count: Int`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/count)The number of elements in the collection.[`var count: Int`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/count-37f7u)The number of elements in the collection.[`var endIndex: DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/endindex)The collection’s “past the end” position—that is, the position one greater than the last valid subscript argument.[`var first: Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/first)The first element of the collection.[`var indices: DefaultIndices<Self>`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/indices-swift.property)The indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.[`var isEmpty: Bool`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/isempty)A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.[`var isEmpty: Bool`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/isempty-6y6jl)A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.[`var startIndex: DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/startindex)The position of the first element in a nonempty collection.[`var underestimatedCount: Int`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/underestimatedcount)A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the collection.### [Instance Methods](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/collection-implementations#Instance-Methods)

[`func distance(from: DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index, to: DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index) -> Int`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/distance(from:to:))Returns the distance between two indices.[`func distance(from: Self.Index, to: Self.Index) -> Int`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/distance(from:to:)-7p9uz)Returns the distance between two indices.[`func drop(while: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/drop(while:))Returns a subsequence by skipping elements while `predicate` returns `true` and returning the remaining elements.[`func dropFirst(Int) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/dropfirst(_:))Returns a subsequence containing all but the given number of initial elements.[`func dropLast(Int) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/droplast(_:))Returns a subsequence containing all but the specified number of final elements.[`func firstIndex(of: Self.Element) -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/firstindex(of:))Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.[`func firstIndex(where: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/firstindex(where:))Returns the first index in which an element of the collection satisfies the given predicate.[`func formIndex(inout Self.Index, offsetBy: Int)`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/formindex(_:offsetby:))Offsets the given index by the specified distance.[`func formIndex(inout Self.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: Self.Index) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/formindex(_:offsetby:limitedby:))Offsets the given index by the specified distance, or so that it equals the given limiting index.[`func formIndex(after: inout Self.Index)`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/formindex(after:))Replaces the given index with its successor.[`func index(Self.Index, offsetBy: Int) -> Self.Index`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/index(_:offsetby:))Returns an index that is the specified distance from the given index.[`func index(Self.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: Self.Index) -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/index(_:offsetby:limitedby:))Returns an index that is the specified distance from the given index, unless that distance is beyond a given limiting index.[`func index(after: DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index) -> DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/index(after:))Returns the position immediately after the given index.[`func index(of: Self.Element) -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/index(of:))Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.[`func indices(of: Self.Element) -> RangeSet<Self.Index>`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/indices(of:))Returns the indices of all the elements that are equal to the given element.[`func indices(where: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> RangeSet<Self.Index>`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/indices(where:))Returns the indices of all the elements that match the given predicate.[`func makeIterator() -> IndexingIterator<Self>`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/makeiterator())Returns an iterator over the elements of the collection.[`func map<T, E>((Self.Element) throws(E) -> T) throws(E) -> [T]`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/map(_:)-44xuh)Returns an array containing the results of mapping the given closure over the sequence’s elements.[`func popFirst() -> Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/popfirst())Removes and returns the first element of the collection.[`func prefix(Int) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/prefix(_:))Returns a subsequence, up to the specified maximum length, containing the initial elements of the collection.[`func prefix(through: Self.Index) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/prefix(through:))Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection through the specified position.[`func prefix(upTo: Self.Index) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/prefix(upto:))Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection up to, but not including, the specified position.[`func prefix(while: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/prefix(while:))Returns a subsequence containing the initial elements until `predicate` returns `false` and skipping the remaining elements.[`func randomElement() -> Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/randomelement())Returns a random element of the collection.[`func randomElement<T>(using: inout T) -> Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/randomelement(using:))Returns a random element of the collection, using the given generator as a source for randomness.[`func removeFirst() -> Self.Element`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/removefirst())Removes and returns the first element of the collection.[`func removeFirst(Int)`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/removefirst(_:))Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.[`func removingSubranges(RangeSet<Self.Index>) -> DiscontiguousSlice<Self>`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/removingsubranges(_:))Returns a collection of the elements in this collection that are not represented by the given range set.[`func split(maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool, whereSeparator: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> [Self.SubSequence]`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/split(maxsplits:omittingemptysubsequences:whereseparator:))Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, that don’t contain elements satisfying the given predicate.[`func split(separator: Self.Element, maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool) -> [Self.SubSequence]`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/split(separator:maxsplits:omittingemptysubsequences:)-5ji1p)Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, around elements equal to the given element.[`func suffix(Int) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/suffix(_:))Returns a subsequence, up to the given maximum length, containing the final elements of the collection.[`func suffix(from: Self.Index) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/suffix(from:))Returns a subsequence from the specified position to the end of the collection.### [Subscripts](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/collection-implementations#Subscripts)

[`subscript(Range<DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index>) -> DiscontiguousSlice<Base>`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/subscript(_:)-1ra8t)Accesses a contiguous subrange of the collection’s elements.[`subscript((UnboundedRange_) -> ()) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/subscript(_:)-1ytel)[`subscript(DiscontiguousSlice<Base>.Index) -> Base.Element`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/subscript(_:)-8h9i0)Accesses the element at the specified position.### [Type Aliases](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/collection-implementations#Type-Aliases)

[`typealias Indices`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/indices)A type that represents the indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.[`typealias SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/discontiguousslice/subsequence)A collection representing a contiguous subrange of this collection’s elements. The subsequence shares indices with the original collection.
